name: OpenAIPullRequestReview
description: This task uses OpenAI-compatible API to review a pull request. This is a fork of the original by larhrouch mustapha
author: John Strand

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown: The provider to use for the AI model.

inputs.name: api_key
inputs.label: API key
inputs.helpMarkDown: API key for OpenAI or Azure OpenAI.

inputs.name: aoi_endpoint
inputs.label: OpenAI-compatible endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: OpenAI-compatible endpoint. If not provided, the default endpoint will be used.

inputs.name: stream_data
inputs.label: Stream data
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to use streaming response

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout (seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The timeout for the AI model.

inputs.name: support_self_signed_certificate
inputs.label: Support self-signed certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to support self-signed certificate.

inputs.name: instructions
inputs.label: Message
inputs.helpMarkDown: The message to send to the AI model.
inputs.defaultValue:
Act as a code reviewer of a Pull Request, providing feedback on possible bugs and other code issues.
You are provided with the Pull Request changes in a patch format.
Each patch entry has the commit message in the Subject line followed by the code changes (diffs) in a unidiff format.

As a code reviewer, your task is:
- Review only added, edited or deleted lines.
- If there are no bugs and the changes are correct, write only 'No feedback.'
- If there are bugs or incorrect code changes, don't write 'No feedback.'

inputs.name: debug_log
inputs.label: Verbose logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to enable verbose logging.
